page.title: 10Malmesbury Cole Park
page.content: A Country Mansion built of brick and stone{2km S.E. of Malmesbury.}In 12th Century it was a Monastery. Later a Royal stud farm for Henry V111 horses. A Georgian Facade was added. The house is surrounded by a moat crossed by a bridge leading to the stone fronted house. At the side of the house is the old priest's pool where carp were kept for the{Abbot of Malmesbury.}The back of the house is brick, topped by tall decorative brick chimneys. In front of this are stone obelisks sculpted by {Simon Verity. Mr. Weinburg}the present owner has altered the inside of the house and rebuilt the kitchen gardens with herringbone brick paths to match the old brick walls. Cole Park now covers 350 acres and includes Rodbourne Rail Farm.
